    • Constructor Detail

      • BinomialBlurGeneric

        public BinomialBlurGeneric(ImageSignPolicyEmbed inOutImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                           CoordinateAxis axis,
                           int nPoints,
                           int skippingStep,
                           VoxelInt shiftOuputMargin)
        Constructs a Convolution Mask for Binomial Blur on the image with a mask characterized by a given support cardinality and a given skipping step (distance between to elements of the mask support) in each direction.
        Parameters:
        inOutImageSignPolicyEmbed - An original image on which to apply the mask. The buffer is used for both input and output. The image must allow values to be added without overflow. Use ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) if necessary.
        axis - The coordinate axis along which to convolve
        nPoints - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; first coordinate
        skippingStep - Skipping step in the direction of the specified axis
        shiftOuputMargin - Margins that were added through enlargement of input buffer.

      • BinomialBlurGeneric

        public BinomialBlurGeneric(ImageSignPolicyEmbed inImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                           ImageSignPolicyEmbed outImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                           CoordinateAxis axis,
                           int nPoints,
                           int skippingStep,
                           VoxelInt shiftOuputMargin)
        Constructs a Convolution Mask for Binomial Blur on the image with a mask characterized by a given support cardinality and a given skipping step (distance between to elements of the mask support) in each direction.
        Parameters:
        inImageSignPolicyEmbed - An original image on which to apply the mask.
        outImageSignPolicyEmbed - An original image on which to apply the mask. The image must allow values to be added without overflow. Use ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) if necessary.
        axis - The coordinate axis along which to convolve
        nPoints - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; first coordinate
        skippingStep - Skipping step in the direction of the specified axis
        shiftOuputMargin - Margins that were added through enlargement of input buffer.

      • BinomialBlurGeneric

        public BinomialBlurGeneric(ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric inImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                           ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric outImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                           CoordinateAxis axis,
                           int nPoints,
                           double realSkippingStep,
                           double voxelEdgesLength,
                           VoxelInt shiftOuputMargin)
        Constructs a Convolution Mask for Binomial Blur on the image with a mask characterized by a given support cardinality and a given skipping step (distance between to elements of the mask support) in each direction. This constructor does the same as BinomialBlurGeneric(ImageSignPolicyEmbed, ImageSignPolicyEmbed, CoordinateAxis, int, int, VoxelInt) except that the skipping steps are given in (approximately) multiples of the calibration data (Voxels edges lengths in a given length unit) instead of number of voxels.
        Parameters:
        inImageSignPolicyEmbed - An original image on which to apply the mask.
        outImageSignPolicyEmbed - An original image on which to apply the mask. The image must allow values to be added without overflow. Use ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) if necessary.
        nPoints - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; first coordinate
        axis - The coordinate axis along which to convolve
        realSkippingStep - Skipping step along the considered axis
        voxelEdgesLength - The voxel's scale (edge's length) used as a factor to estimate actual skipping steps in each direction.
        shiftOuputMargin - Margins that were added through enlargement of input buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • applyMask

        public ConvolutionBaseGeneric applyMask()
        Description copied from interface: ConvolutionBase
        Allows to Convolve the mask of this instance with the image underlying this instance. This is done by embedding the image (if necessary) and storing it in an attribute, which can then be retrieved after normalization. Note that this operation might become protected (and therefore removed from this interface) in the future because its use might be obscure and lead to errors.
        Specified by:
        applyMask in interface ConvolutionBase
        Specified by:
        applyMask in class ConvolutionBaseGeneric
        Returns:
        The reference to this instance to allow for use of the cascade pattern.
        See Also:
        ConvolutionBaseGeneric.applyMask()
